resources.string: Browse Bitcoin and UtxoPocket education topics bundled offline with the app.
Look up quick definitions for Bitcoin concepts.
Who builds UtxoPocket and how to support the project.
Important usage, security, and responsibility notes.
Read and download the Bitcoin Whitepaper
Buy me a coffee via Lightning
Unable to generate a QR code.
UtxoPocket focuses on verifiable, privacy-first watch-only workflows.
Monitor balances, health scores, and labeled UTXOs without exposing private keys or seeds.
Bring any descriptor set—external/change branches, multipath exports, multisig policies—and BDK keeps them in lockstep.
Understands BIP-32/39 key roots, BIP-84/86 derivations, and descriptor policies so your hardware stack plugs in directly.
Import, edit, and export wallet labels with the BIP-329 JSON format to keep naming in sync across devices and signers.
Route every sync over Tor, switch between curated Electrum servers, or add your own onion endpoint for full control.
Score UTXOs and transactions to catch address reuse, dust, and high-risk clusters before you broadcast.
UtxoPocket is a watch-only wallet. Please read this disclaimer:
Watch-only only: no private keys or seeds are stored. You cannot sign transactions here.
No financial advice: the app and its documentation are for educational purposes.
Security and storage: local data is encrypted, but device compromise or misconfiguration can expose it. You are responsible for your setup, backups, and access controls.
Network and trust model: all traffic routes over Tor to Electrum servers you select. Server responses may be malicious or inaccurate; verify with your own node when possible.
No custody or insurance: UtxoPocket never holds funds. Balances are on-chain under your control; there is no deposit protection or insurance.
No warranty: the software is provided “as is” under its open-source license, without warranties or liability. Use at your own risk.
Compliance is your responsibility: ensure your usage complies with local laws and handle any tax or reporting obligations.
Backups: keep independent backups of descriptors and labels (BIP-329). The app does not guarantee backup/restore of this data across devices.
By using UtxoPocket you accept these terms and use the software at your own risk.
Add your first wallet to start tracking balances.
Visit the Wiki to learn more about Bitcoin.
Select a node before adding a wallet.
New wallets will sync once the node reconnects.
Select a node to get started
Choose the node you want to sync with before adding descriptors.
Learn how to connect via Tor
Unable to load data. Pull to refresh and try again.
Unable to generate a QR code for this address.
Unable to read the selected file
Import labels after this wallet has at least one transaction
Tx labels: %1$d · Outputs: %2$d · Spendable: %3$d · Skipped: %4$d · Invalid: %5$d
A wallet with this name already exists
Full rescan queued. Refresh to start syncing.
Unable to queue a full rescan. Please try again.
Keep this enabled when other devices derive addresses for the same descriptors. Turn it off only if UtxoPocket is the sole watcher.
Marked as shared. A full rescan has been queued.
Could not update the shared descriptor setting.
Do you want to remove "%1$s" from UtxoPocket?
This action permanently removes the watch-only wallet from UtxoPocket. It cannot be undone.
Could not delete the wallet. Please try again.
Select the accent used for the wallet background.
Tap the card to explore your balance chart.
Tap the card to return to the summary.
Descriptor copied. Clipboard clears in 60 seconds.
Keep these descriptors private and store a secure backup. Anyone with them can monitor your wallet.
Warning: this is a change address. Avoid sharing it publicly.
Warning: this address has already been used.
Warning: this address was reused %1$d times.
Could not generate QR code for this descriptor.
Describe the flow (salary, stack swap, payout…)
Labels keep provenance synced across wallets via BIP-329.
Transaction analysis is disabled. Enable it in Settings to review privacy and fee posture.
Transaction health signals are unavailable for this entry.
Leave blank to remove the label.
Decide whether this coin should appear as spendable when exporting BIP-329 to your signing wallet.
Unable to update the spendable flag
UTXO analysis is disabled. Enable it in Settings to review your inventory.
UTXO health data is not available for this entry.
Could not renew Tor identity. Try again shortly.
Could not disconnect Tor. Try again shortly.
Could not connect to Tor. Try again shortly.
Syncs and Electrum calls route through Tor automatically.
Tor disconnected. Start Tor before connecting to nodes.
Tor will start automatically. This may take a moment.
Waiting for Tor to finish connecting…
Connect to Wi‑Fi or mobile data before reconnecting.
Select a node to resume syncing.
Select a node to reconnect and resume syncing.
Connect to a node to view recent block, fee, and server information.
Select a node under the Manage tab to reconnect and resume syncing.
Get testnet bitcoin from a faucet
Use a %1$s faucet to rehearse transactions without risking mainnet funds.
Select a faucet to open it in your browser.
Supported descriptor templates: wpkh(), wsh(), sh(), tr(), pkh(), combo(), (sorted)multi().
Invalid or malformed descriptor; review the imported descriptor or the compatibility wiki article.
No wildcard detected; only a single address will be tracked.
Descriptor does not include wildcard "*"; only a single address will be tracked.
No change descriptor provided. Change addresses will reuse the external branch.
Change descriptor is missing wildcard "*"; change addresses cannot be derived.
Change descriptor should use the /1/* branch to avoid address reuse.
This descriptor appears to belong to %1$s, but %2$s is currently selected. Switch networks before continuing?
Receive/change pair detected. The change branch has been moved to the change descriptor input so that UtxoPocket can validate both.
Keep this enabled if you also monitor this wallet with other apps or hardware devices. UtxoPocket schedules full rescans automatically to discover addresses revealed elsewhere.
Extended key used on other devices
Leave this on when the same extended key is imported elsewhere so UtxoPocket keeps tracking the change branch.
Paste or scan the extended public key export from your hardware wallet or another app. UtxoPocket builds descriptors automatically.
Optional origin metadata. Match what your hardware wallet shows so exports stay compatible.
Four-byte hex fingerprint of the root key; improves import/export parity.
Pick the template your wallet exported (Legacy, Nested SegWit, Native SegWit, Taproot).
Disable only if you need receive addresses and will never monitor change.
UtxoPocket detected an extended public key. Confirm the script type before continuing.
Pick the exact script template your other wallet exported; balances will not appear if the type mismatches.
Shows raw technical data across the app.
Compute privacy and fee heuristics for each transaction.
Evaluate your UTXO set for dust, reuse, and pending consolidation.
Combine transaction and UTXO insights into a wallet-wide score.
Turn on transaction and UTXO analysis to enable Wallet health.
Adjust auto-lock when the app is protected with a PIN.
Confirm your PIN to adjust the auto-lock timer.
Erase every wallet, transaction, UTXO, and health record stored on this device.
This will permanently delete every wallet, cached sync state, and health report stored locally.
Confirm once more to wipe all wallet data. You will need to re-import descriptors to keep using the app.
All wallet data has been erased.
Failed to erase wallet data. Try again.
Wallet health needs transaction and UTXO analysis to run. Turn both on?
Turning off transaction analysis will also disable Wallet health.
Turning off UTXO analysis will also disable Wallet health.
Fine-tune scoring thresholds for transaction and UTXO health checks.
Calculating wallet health… keep the app open while metrics refresh.
Foreground service updates for Tor connectivity.
Jump into dedicated screens for wallet, security, and interface controls.
Flag small outputs automatically to review them before spending.
Set to 0 to disable dust warnings.
Control shimmer and rolling balance motion in the wallet list.
Set the primary language, preferred units, and theme for the app.
Control wallet health toggles and advanced UTXO tools.
Manage the PIN lock and trigger the panic wipe flow.
Require a 6-digit PIN when opening the app.
Mirror your hardware wallets, monitor health scores, and stay behind Tor without exposing a single private key.
Track balances, transaction health, UTXO scans, and custom labels while your signing devices stay offline.
Paste external/change descriptors or BIP-389 exports to recreate your wallet map exactly, so every address and label matches your hardware tracker.
Understands BIP-32/39 seeds, BIP-84/86 derivations, and descriptor policies so multisig stacks plug in without gymnastics.
Every sync rides over Tor, and you can stick with curated Electrum presets or drop in your own onion endpoint when you need total custody of metadata.
Aim UtxoPocket at your own node or an onion peer to keep third parties out of your validation loop.
Camera permission is required to scan QR codes.
No valid node endpoint detected in the QR code.
Only onion addresses are supported. Provide an onion URL.
Custom nodes require Tor. Switching between presets or onions keeps Tor running until you disconnect.
Removing %1$s will disconnect it if active. Continue?
Custom nodes now accept onion endpoints only. Review these notes before testing your hidden service.
Paste the .onion hostname. If the QR or link includes “:port” we will fill the Port field automatically. Otherwise the default Electrum port (50001) is used.
All curated and custom nodes route over Tor. Tor stays active while any node is selected and shuts down once you disconnect.
Electrum traffic runs as plaintext TCP inside the Tor tunnel. SSL/TLS toggles were removed so the flow stays consistent and avoids clearnet leaks.
Keep at least one preset server enabled so you can recover quickly if your onion endpoint is offline. Verify your hidden service is reachable before switching.
Enter the onion hostname (host or host:port). The port field below mirrors whatever you include here.
Custom nodes must use .onion addresses. Traffic always routes through Tor over plaintext Electrum TCP.
All connections are routed via Tor by default.
Enter the server URL or IP address reachable from this device (e.g. electrum.example.com or 10.0.0.4).
This node does not expose connection details.
Latest sats/vB estimate reported by your node.
This connection can run without Tor.
Switch between preset and custom nodes for this network.
Add your first node to get started.
We could not find the article you requested.
Try different keywords or clear the search to browse all topics.
Enter a 6-digit PIN and confirm it to secure access to UtxoPocket.
Enter a 6-digit PIN. You will confirm it next.
Re-enter the same PIN to confirm.
Could not save PIN. Please try again.
Enter your current PIN to disable the lock.
PIN does not match. Please try again.
Incorrect PIN. Please wait %1$s before trying again.
Too many failed attempts. Try again in %1$s.
Camera permission is required to scan descriptors.
We couldn\'t find a descriptor in that QR code.
Try a different term or reset the search to see the full list.
We could not find that definition.
